meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: This Order may be cited as the Special Areas (Designation) (Consolidation) Order.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Designation of Government land as special areas
section.text: The areas of Government land specified in the Schedule are designated as special areas for the purposes of the Ordinance.

section.name: s1
section.content: The area of Government land known as the Tai Po Kau Nature Reserve delineated and bounded in red on Plan No. SA/TPK dated 25 May 1976 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 105 of 1977)

section.name: s2
section.content: The area of Government land on Tung Lung Island comprising Tung Lung Fort and the adjacent land delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/TLF dated 13 June 1979 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 164 of 1979)

section.name: s3
section.content: Those areas of Government land near the village of Tsiu Hang in the northern part of Pak Sha Wan Peninsula delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/TH dated 1 December 1987 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 420 of 1987)

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: Those areas of Government land in Tolo Harbour on—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the unnamed island about 100 m northeast of the shore of Yim Tin Tsai near Sam Mun Tsai New Village,

section.continued: all delineated in black and coloured pink, except those portions within such areas marked with black hatching, on Plan No. SA/MSCB dated 12 November 1998 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 93 of 1999)

section.name: s5
section.content: The area of Government land at Lai Chi Wo delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/LCW dated 8 December 2004 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 216 of 2004)

section.name: s6
section.content: The area of Government land known as the Hong Kong Wetland Park delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/HKWP dated 27 April 2005 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 64 of 2005)

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: Those areas of Government land in Double Haven on—
section.continued: delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/DH dated August 2010 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 137 of 2010)

section.name: s8
section.content: Those areas of Government land on Po Pin Chau and Conic Island near High Island delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/HI dated August 2010 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 137 of 2010)

section.name: s9
section.content: Those areas of Government land in the Rocky Area and on the unnamed rock offshore the Rocky Area near the Kiu Tsui Beach and pier in the western part of Sharp Island delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/SI dated August 2010 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 137 of 2010)

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: Those areas of Government land in Ung Kong Group on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Kong Tau Pai and the adjoining unnamed islands;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Wang Chau and the adjoining unnamed islands;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Pin Chau, Yuen Kong Chau and Tung Sam Chau;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Pyramid Rock, Basalt Island, Tai Pai, Yi Pai, Sam Pai, Lung Shuen Pai, Po Yue Pai and the adjoining unnamed islands;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Bluff Island, Fan Tap Pai and the adjoining unnamed islands; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Kam Chung Ngam in the southern part of Jin Island,

section.continued: delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/UKG dated August 2010 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 137 of 2010)

section.name: s11
section.leadIn: Those areas of Government land in Ninepin Group on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: East Ninepin Island, consisting of Shue Long Chau, Tuen Chau Tsai, Lung Shuen Pai and an adjoining unnamed island;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: North Ninepin Island, consisting of Hok Tsai Pai, Sai Chau Mei and the adjoining unnamed islands; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: South Ninepin Island, consisting of Shan Leng Kok, Tai Chau, Tai Chau Mei and the adjoining unnamed islands,

section.continued: delineated in black and coloured pink on Plan No. SA/NG dated August 2010 and deposited in the office of the Country and Marine Parks Authority. (L.N. 137 of 2010)
